title: Bug 3666 - Code Completion Eating Code
description: Code completion is consuming excessive code in certain cases, causing an incorrect program behavior. The enclosed class demonstrates the issue where adding a parameter to the 'baz' call within 'bar' is necessary for program correctness. The code assist option affecting the replacement amount needs clarification.
OB: The code currently changes the statement 'baz(x.foo());' to 'baz(x.foo()x.foo());' when it should produce 'baz(x.x.foo());'.
EB: The expected behavior is for the code assist to replace the code appropriately, resulting in 'baz(x.x.foo());'.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Modify the 'baz' call in the 'bar' method to 'baz(x.x.foo());'.
2. Place the cursor after the first 'x.'.
3. Use Ctrl + Space to invoke code assist.
4. Filter the list by typing 'f'.
5. Select 'foo()' from the filtered list.
